chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
Y: Prop
X: Prop

Goal:
dec X -> dec Y -> ~ (X -> Y) -> X /\ ~ Y

Premises:
dec = fun X : Prop => {X} + {~ X} : Prop -> Type Arguments dec _%type_scope
dec_DM_and : forall X Y : Prop, dec X -> dec Y -> ~ (X /\ Y) -> ~ X \/ ~ Y
Dec_reflect_eq : forall (X Y : Prop) (d : dec X) (e : dec Y), Dec X = Dec Y < -> (X <-> Y)
DM_or : forall X Y : Prop, ~ (X \/ Y) < -> ~ X /\ ~ Y
Dec_auto_not : forall (X : Prop) (d : dec X), ~ X -> ~ Dec X
dec_DN : forall X : Prop, dec X -> ~ ~ X -> X
Dec_auto : forall (X : Prop) (d : dec X), X -> Dec X
Dec : forall X : Prop, dec X -> dec X
Dec_reflect : forall (X : Prop) (d : dec X), Dec X < -> X
DM_exists : forall (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop), ~ (exists x : X, p x) < -> (forall x : X, ~ p x)
Dec_false : forall (P : Prop) (H : dec P), Dec P = false -> ~ P
Dec_false' : forall (P : Prop) (d : dec P), ~ P -> Dec P = false
dec2bool : forall P : Prop, dec P -> bool
Dec_true : forall (P : Prop) (H : dec P), Dec P = true -> P
Dec_true' : forall (P : Prop) (d : dec P), P -> Dec P = true
Decidable.not_iff : forall A B : Prop, Decidable.decidable A -> Decidable.decidable B -> ~ (A <-> B) -> A /\ ~ B \/ ~ A /\ B
Decidable.not_imp : forall A B : Prop, Decidable.decidable A -> ~ (A -> B) -> A /\ ~ B
Decidable.not_and : forall A B : Prop, Decidable.decidable A -> ~ (A /\ B) -> ~ A \/ ~ B
ssrbool.xorPif : forall (P Q : Prop) (b : bool), reflect P b -> Q \/ P -> ~ (Q /\ P) -> if b then ~ Q else Q
ssrbool.xorPifn : forall (P Q : Prop) (b : bool), reflect P (negb b) -> Q \/ P -> ~ (Q /\ P) -> if b then Q else ~ Q
OrderedRing.Rtimes_neq_0 : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (rplus rtimes rminus : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req rle rlt : R -> R -> Prop), OrderedRing.SOR rO rI rplus rtimes rminus ropp req rle rlt -> forall n m : R, ~ req n rO /\ ~ req m rO -> ~ req (rtimes n m) rO
Inductive GFormula (TA TX AA AF : Type) : Type := TT : Tauto.GFormula | FF : Tauto.GFormula | X : TX -> Tauto.GFormula | A : TA -> AA -> Tauto.GFormula | Cj : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | D : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | N : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | I : Tauto.GFormula -> option AF -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula Arguments Tauto.GFormula {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.TT {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.FF {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.X {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.A {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.Cj {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.D {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.N {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.I {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope
Tauto.eval_f = fun (TA TX AA AF : Type) (ex : TX -> Prop) (ea : TA -> Prop) => fix eval_f (f : Tauto.GFormula) : Prop := match f with | Tauto.TT => True | Tauto.FF => False | Tauto.X p => ex p | Tauto.A a _ => ea a | Tauto.Cj e1 e2 => eval_f e1 /\ eval_f e2 | Tauto.D e1 e2 => eval_f e1 \/ eval_f e2 | Tauto.N e => ~ eval_f e | Tauto.I f1 _ f2 => eval_f f1 -> eval_f f2 end : forall TA TX AA AF : Type, (TX -> Prop) -> (TA -> Prop) -> Tauto.GFormula -> Prop Arguments Tauto.eval_f {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope (_ _)%function_scope
RingMicromega.eval_op1 : forall R : Type, R -> (R -> R -> Prop) -> (R -> R -> Prop) -> (R -> R -> Prop) -> RingMicromega.Op1 -> R -> Prop
Decidable.decidable = fun P : Prop => P \/ ~ P : Prop -> Prop Arguments Decidable.decidable _%type_scope
Decidable.not_or : forall A B : Prop, ~ (A \/ B) -> ~ A /\ ~ B
OrderedRing.Rlt_le_neq : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (rplus rtimes rminus : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req rle rlt : R -> R -> Prop), OrderedRing.SOR rO rI rplus rtimes rminus ropp req rle rlt -> forall n m : R, rlt n m < -> rle n m /\ ~ req n m
OrderedRing.SORlt_le_neq : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (rplus rtimes rminus : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req rle rlt : R -> R -> Prop), OrderedRing.SOR rO rI rplus rtimes rminus ropp req rle rlt -> forall n m : R, rlt n m < -> rle n m /\ ~ req n m
Field_theory.NPEequiv : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> (R -> R -> Prop) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Prop
Field_theory.PCond : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> (R -> R -> Prop) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> list R -> list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> Prop
Refl.make_conj : forall A : Type, (A -> Prop) -> list A -> Prop
Ring_polynom.interp_PElist : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> (R -> R -> Prop) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> list R -> list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C * Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> Prop
In : forall A : Type, A -> list A -> Prop
ssrbool.classically = fun P : Type => forall b : bool, (P -> b) -> b : Type -> Prop Arguments ssrbool.classically _%type_scope
Field_theory.ropp_neq_0 : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> forall r : R, ~ req (ropp rI) rO -> ~ req r rO -> ~ req (ropp r) rO
Field_theory.field_is_integral_domain : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> forall r1 r2 : R, ~ req r1 rO -> ~ req r2 rO -> ~ req (rmul r1 r2) rO
Record field_theory (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_field { F_R : Ring_theory.ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req; F_1_neq_0 : ~ req rI rO; Fdiv_def : forall p q : R, req (rdiv p q) (rmul p (rinv q)); Finv_l : forall p : R, ~ req p rO -> req (rmul (rinv p) p) rI } Arguments Field_theory.field_theory [R]%type_scope _ _ (_ _ _ _ _ _ _)%function_scope Arguments Field_theory.mk_field [R]%type_scope [rO rI] [radd rmul rsub ropp]%function_scope (_ _)%function_scope [req]%function_scope _ _ (_ _)%function_scope
Record almost_field_theory (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_afield { AF_AR : Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req; AF_1_neq_0 : ~ req rI rO; AFdiv_def : forall p q : R, req (rdiv p q) (rmul p (rinv q)); AFinv_l : forall p : R, ~ req p rO -> req (rmul (rinv p) p) rI } Arguments Field_theory.almost_field_theory [R]%type_scope _ _ (_ _ _ _ _ _ _)%function_scope Arguments Field_theory.mk_afield [R]%type_scope [rO rI] [radd rmul rsub ropp]%function_scope (_ _)%function_scope [req]%function_scope _ _ (_ _)%function_scope
Field_theory.rinv_nz : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> forall a : R, ~ req a rO -> ~ req (rinv a) rO
Field_theory.PCond_cons : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (phi : C -> R) (Cpow : Type) (Cp_phi : N -> Cpow) (rpow : R -> Cpow -> R) (l : list R) (a : Ring_polynom.PExpr C) (l1 : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C)), Field_theory.PCond rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req phi Cp_phi rpow l (a :: l1) < -> ~ req (Ring_polynom.PEeval rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp phi Cp_phi rpow l a) rO /\ Field_theory.PCond rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req phi Cp_phi rpow l l1
Field_theory.pow_pos_nz : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> forall (x : R) (p : positive), ~ req x rO -> ~ req (Ring_theory.pow_pos rmul x p) rO
